The name of the airport of the runway assigned by the ATC. Returns "" if no runway is assigned.

This float represents the distance between the player's plane and the center of the runway selected
                    by

This float represents the true heading of the runway selected by the ATC. (Not previsouly in FSX)
The length of the runway assigned by the ATC. Returns -1 if no runway is assigned.

This is a float corresponding to the player's main gear relative X (transverse) position on the

                    selected by the ATC. (Exposes values that previously existed in FSX)

This is a float corresponding to the player's main gear relative Y (height) position on the runway
                    selected by the ATC. (Exposes values that previously existed in FSX)

This is a float corresponding to the player's main gear relative Z (longitudinal) position on the
                    runway
                    selected by the ATC. (Exposes values that previously existed in FSX)

This is a boolean corresponding to whether or not the ATC has pre-selected a runway for the player's
                    plane. If this is false, every other ATC_RUNWAY SimVar will return default values. (Exposes values
                    that
                    previously existed in FSX)

This is a float corresponding to the horizontal distance between the player's plane and the start of
                    the
                    runway selected by the ATC. (Exposes values that previously existed in FSX)

Boolean, toggles the autopilotFlight Level Change mode
Indexed from 1, 100 is fully deployed, 0flat on deck

A number 1 through 4 for the cable number caught by the tailhook. Cable 1 is the one closest to the
                    stern of the carrier. A value of 0 indicates no cable was caught.

Catapults are indexed from 1. This value will be 0 before the catapult fires, and then up to 100 as
                    the
                    aircraft is propelled down the catapult. The aircraft may takeoff before the value reaches 100
                    (depending on the aircraft weight, power applied, and other factors), in which case this value will
                    not
                    be further updated. This value could be used to drive a bogie animation.

Holdback bars allow build up of thrust before takeoff from a catapult, and are installed by the deck
                    crew of an aircraft carrier.

This will be True if the launchbar is fully extended, and can be used, for example, to change the
                    color
                    of an instrument light.

Installed on aircraft before takeoff from a carrier catapult. Note that gear cannot retract with
                    this
                    extended. 100 = fully extended. Refer to the document Notes on Aircraft Systems.
If this is set to True the launch bar switch has been engaged.

Maximum of 4. A model can contain more than 4 catapults, but only the first four will be read and
                    recognized by the simulation.

The speed of the aircraft relative to the speed of the first surface directly underneath it. Use
                    this to
                    retrieve, for example, an aircraft's taxiing speed while it is moving on a moving carrier. It also
                    applies to airborne aircraft, for example when a helicopter is successfully hovering above a moving
                    ship, this value should be zero. The returned value will be the same as GROUND VELOCITY if the first
                    surface beneath it is not moving.
True if the tailhook handle is engaged.
Is the aircraft using the new Electrical System or the FSX one
The position of the helicopter's collective. 0 is fully up, 100 fully depressed.
Electrical load.Applies only to Bell helicopter.
Fuel pressure.Applies only to Bell helicopter.

Rotor rpm. Returns main rotor rpm for Bell helicopter, or the indexed rotor rpm of other
                    helicopters.

Torque. Returns main rotor torque for Bell helicopter, or the indexed rotor torque of other
                    helicopters.
Transmission pressure.Applies only to Bell helicopter.
Transmission temperature.Applies only to Bell helicopter.
Turbine temperature. Applies only to Bell helicopter.
Set to true if this object is attached to a sling.

The number of sling cables (not hoists) that are configured for the aircraft. Refer to the document
                    Notes on Aircraft Systems.
The number of objects at the payload station (indexed from 1).

Places the named object at the payload station identified by the index (starting from 1). The string
                    is
                    the Container name (refer to the title property of Simulation Object Configuration Files).

The payload station (identified by the parameter) where objects will be placed from the sling
                    (identified by the index).
True if the cable is broken.
The length of the cable extending from the aircraft.
The percentage of the full length of the sling cable deployed.

A Boolean for whether or not the hook is in pickup mode, so capable of picking up another
                    object.

If units are set as boolean, returns True if a sling object is attached. If units are set as a
                    string,
                    returns the container title of the object.There can be multiple sling positions, indexed from 1. The
                    sling positions are set in the Aircraft Configuration File.
Float, the torque applied on the free turbine
